summary: The bill, titled the Refugees Using Legal Entry Safely Act (RULES Act), amends the Immigration and Nationality Act. It focuses on modifying asylum eligibility requirements, primarily concerning how and where asylum applications can be made. It mandates applications must occur at ports of entry, eliminating parole or release into the U.S. for asylum seekers. It also addresses the status of individuals apprehended after entering the U.S. without inspection, or overstaying their authorized period of stay.
